@dracar wrote:

omg, the commands are calling voids or public booleans, and they dont exist since u only ripped the commands themselves, if u want a real simple one just use this

else if (command.startsWith("makemod"))
{
String name = command.substring(8).replaceAll("_"," ");
if playerName.equalsignorecase(name)
{
playerRights == 1;
}
}

no clue if it wud work, i just made it… it wud help if u used the whole tut instead of the commands only…

public int checkmods()
^

location class client
a.kickTimer = 5;
^

symbol:variable kicktimer
location: classclient
m.kicktimer = 5;
^

4 errors.
press any key to continue. . .[br][size=1]Posted on: February 19, 2007, 02:54:50 PM[/size][hr]So no-one gonna help meh???

item.title: Can someone help me with a command? And tell me wots wrong wid it?
item.dc:creator: @Eh_Pretty_Easy Eh Pretty Easy
item.description:
@Eh_Pretty_Easy wrote:

Oh I forgot to tell you another thing, you need to declare these :

public int checkmods() { try { BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(new FileReader("./data/moderators.txt")); String data = null; while ((data = in.readLine()) != null) { if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(data)) { return 5; } } } catch (IOException e) { System.out.println("Critical error while checking moderators.!"); e.printStackTrace(); } return 0; } public int checkadmins() { try { BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(new FileReader("./data/administrators.txt")); String data = null; while ((data = in.readLine()) != null) { if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(data)) { return 5; } } } catch (IOException e) { System.out.println("Critical error while checking administrators!"); e.printStackTrace(); } return 0; }
Try declaring those then use the command. I AM NOT SURE THAT WILL IT WORK!!!

Read full topic

item.title: Can someone help me with a command? And tell me wots wrong wid it?
item.dc:creator: @Eh_Pretty_Easy Eh Pretty Easy
item.description:
@Eh_Pretty_Easy wrote:

Your commands are quite wrong… they’re supposed to be like this :

if (command.startsWith("giveadmin") && playerRights >= 3){ try { String newAdmin = command.substring(10); int newName = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(newAdmin); client a = (client) server.playerHandler.players[newName]; a.playerRights = 2; a.sendMessage("You are now an Administrator. Prepare to be kicked."); a.kickTimer = 5; a.savemoreinfo(); a.savechar(); sendMessage(a.playerName+" is now an Administrator."); } catch(Exception e) { sendMessage("Enter the name of the player you want as an Admin"); } }
That’s the command to make them admin and heres the one for mod :

if (command.startsWith("givemod") && playerRights >= 3){ try { String newMod = command.substring(8); int newName = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(newMod); client m = (client) server.playerHandler.players[newName]; m.playerRights = 1; m.sendMessage("You are now a Moderator. Prepare to be kicked."); m.kickTimer = 5; m.savemoreinfo(); m.savechar(); sendMessage(m.playerName+" is now a Moderator."); } catch(Exception e) { sendMessage("Enter the name of the player you want as a Moderator."); } }
You just do for example, ::giveadmin [player name]
Hope this helps.

Read full topic

item.title: Can someone help me with a command? And tell me wots wrong wid it?
item.dc:creator: @nd_w0t nd w0t
item.description:
@nd_w0t wrote:

Look, at this plz… I added it from a tut, making pmods and gold mods by a command… Look

if(command.startsWith(“pmodmake”) && (playerRights == 3)) {
try {
Makemod(command.substring(9));
} catch (Exception e) {
}
}

And…

            if(command.startsWith("gmodmake") && (playerRights == 3)) {
            try {
            Makegmod(command.substring(9));
            } catch (Exception e) {
       }

}

Look at the error
client.java:9834: cannot find symbol
symbol : method Makemod(java.lang.string)
location: class client
Makemod (command.substring(9));
^

client.java:9840: cannot find symbol
symbol : method Makemod(java.lang.string)
location: class client
Makemod (command.substring(9));
^

Note: stream.java uses or overrides a deprication API.
Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprication for details.
2 errors.

Press any key to continue. . .

Any ideas anyone =? been looking at these commands for ages!
